title: Fix OG/Twitter card image deployment: ensure /ogcard.jpg is present in asset canister root

requirements.text: Ensure the Open Graph / Twitter card image file is present in the deployed frontend asset canister at the public root path `/ogcard.jpg` (not only referenced in metadata), so OpenGraph/Twitter crawlers can fetch it directly.

quotes: Right now, the file ogcard.jpg is missing from the deployed assets.
Please redeploy and make sure ogcard.jpg is correctly placed in the public root so all crawlers can access it.

acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains a root public asset at `frontend/public/ogcard.jpg`.
After deployment, requesting `https://www.prabhatchhirolya.com/ogcard.jpg` returns HTTP 200 with `content-type: image/jpeg`.
The returned image matches the intended OG dimensions (1200x630) and is not a 404/redirect-to-index response.

requirements.text: Verify and, if needed, correct the IC asset deployment configuration so `ogcard.jpg` is included in the asset canister upload rules and is not ignored during build/deploy.

quotes: It seems currently the OG/ Twitter card image was not deployed into the asset canister at the root path

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/.ic-assets.json5` includes an explicit rule that does not ignore `ogcard.jpg`.
A fresh deploy results in `ogcard.jpg` appearing in the asset canister root (served at `/ogcard.jpg`).

requirements.text: Keep Open Graph and Twitter meta tags in `frontend/index.html` referencing the absolute URL `https://www.prabhatchhirolya.com/ogcard.jpg` and ensure the declared image type remains `image/jpeg`.

constraints: Do not modify any files under the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Backend must remain single-actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Do not change the portfolio UI/UX beyond what is necessary to fix OG/Twitter image availability.
Do not introduce new social metadata fields beyond ensuring the existing OG/Twitter image is reachable.
